Authors:
Bhushan Shrestha, Min-Woo Hyun, Junsang Oh, Jae-Gu Han, Tae
Ho Lee, Jae Youl Cho Cho, Hyojeung Kang, Seong Hwan Kim, Gi-Ho Sung
Title:
Molecular evidence of a teleomorph-anamorph connection
between Cordyceps scarabaeicola and Beauveria sungii and its implication
for the systematics of Cordyceps sensu stricto
Keywords:
Cordyceps scarabaeicola, Beauveria sungii, phylogeny,
nomenclature, teleomorph-anamorph connection
Abstract:
A teleomorph of a new Beauveria species, Beauveria sungii
S.A. Rehner & Humber, is identified as Cordyceps scarabaeicola Y.
Kobayasi based on the teleomorphic material of the B. sungii isolate
used in the recent phylogenetic study. Cordyceps Fr. 1818 is an older
generic name than Beauveria Vuill. 1912 in Cordyceps sensu stricto.
Here, C. scarabaeicola is suggested to be adopted for B. sungii on the
priority basis of both generic name and species epithet in compliance
with the recent revision of Article 59 of the Melbourne Code (recently
changed to the ‘International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi and
plant’ or ICN). The pros and cons of a unified nomenclature for
pleomorphic fungi are briefly discussed with reference to
Beauveria.
